snippet: Pippi Longstocking’s language has become part of a growing and often uncomfortable debate about ethnicity in Sweden.
abstract: Swedish broadcaster SVT's decision to edit two scenes it considers racially offensive from 1969 television series based on Pippi Longstocking books by Astrid Lindgren has ignited national debate; move taps into growing and often uncomfortable discussion over ethnicity in country where small minority is just beginning to have a voice.
lead_paragraph: Pippi Longstocking’s language has become part of a growing and often uncomfortable debate about ethnicity in Sweden.

headline.seo: Pippi Longstocking’s Words to Be Modified for TV
headline.main: Sweden’s Storybook Heroine Ignites a Debate on Race
headline.print_headline: Sweden’s Storybook Heroine Ignites a Debate on Race
